# PRO proto πρωτο protho πρῶτος first bereshid בראשית 1 by-ratio 𒊕𒆗 “first one”

Since Proto-Elamite and Proto-Sumerian are very similar, they shall just be labeled "proto"

Excessive prefix in myriad similar forms and meanings:
proto protho first fore vor for pro 𓉐 𓂋
⇔ πρό pró pre- be“fore” vor ⇔ pro : für for per par para

𓌡 𓈙 𓐟 𒀸 aš

𓃾 al'pha®

𓃀 burat ⲣⲁⲧ ⲫⲁⲧ ⲣ p/ro

pronto

𓁶 𓊪 𓏏 proto pronto front ᵖhead | 𓁶 𓏏 𓊪 | tip, top| reversed

𓊃 𓊪 𓏏 𓊗 𓌐 first 𓊃 𓊪 𓏏 𓊗 𓏮 second …

𓌐 first

𒂍 BIT better 𒂍𒊒𒋾 bit-ru-ti proto "prime" (quality)

𒁍𒌅 pu-tu “front”
𒁍𒌅 forehead, brow ⇔ proto

𒉺𒉡 pa-nu first •pran •pron •prān

𒌑 ≈ 𒋰𒐈𒋰 •proto > fret > food 𒌑 ≈ 𒋰𒐈𒋰 •proto > pro verb!

πroot

𒌑 ʳúᵈ root / reed 𒊑𒐊𒌅 ri-i-tú rītu "pasture" etc <> πraš 𒌑 ʳúᵈ արոտ arot "pasture" < prat prado proto prairie <> βοτάνη botánē νομός nomós "pasture" !!

𒊕𒌅 ᵉris-tu erst < first (born) 𒀀𒊓𒊑𒁺 ᶠa-sa-ri-du first 1 proto 𓊪 𓅮 𓄿 𓏏 𓏮 𓏗 Protheus 𓏌 𓏌 𓏌 𓅱 𓇯 𓈗 𒀀 ≈ 𓏌

𒁇𒈬 ⋍ 𓉐 𓂋 𓏏 𓇳 ( Mišil Šatti, first season ⇔ proto )

𓄂 πρό pró “(be)fore” forepart прамац pramac πρῷρα prôira pruva prow ⇔ paw

𓅱 as prefix is elusive
While 𓅱 as infix or suffix the important component is ᵂR in prefix its Wʳ < µPʳ !
𓅱 µPʳ>PH>B/F>V>Wʳ>U
